text: Reese Fork is a stream in Audrain, Monroe and Randolph counties the U.S. state of Missouri. It is a tributary to Allen Creek.Madison, MO, 7.5 Minute Topographic Quadrangle, USGS, 2017 The stream headwaters arise in southeastern Randolph County along the east side of Missouri Route P about 2.5 miles north of the community of Clark with an elevation of 850 feet at .Clark, MO, 7.5 Minute Topographic Quadrangle, USGS, 1953 (1983 rev) The stream flows east into northwestern Audrain County then turns to the northeast and enters Monroe County. The stream enters Allen Creek adjacent to Missouri Route 151 six miles south of Madison. The confluence is at at an elevation of 741 feet. Reese Fork has the name of an early settler. ==See also== *List of rivers of Missouri ==References== Category:Rivers of Audrain County, Missouri Category:Rivers of Monroe County, Missouri Category:Rivers of Randolph County, Missouri Category:Rivers of Missouri
title: Reese Fork
